skill.name: behaviors.skills.primitives.Operate
skill.description: For an agent to move toward an object that can be operated, and operate it. Once the system is reached, the agent starts operating it in order to make the object applying the effect it has been made for. Because operating a system requires the presence of the agent, action can only be done on one system at a time.

link.name: reach
link.description: To enact the decision to "reach" the system.

link.name: operate
link.description: To enact the decision to operate the system once it is reached.

feedback.name: operating
feedback.description: Sent once the agent is operating the issued system.

feedback.name: failed
feedback.description: Sent if the agent is not able to operate the issued system. It means that the element issued cannot be operated (see object capacities definition in authoring tool).
